alice.tuprolog

Class ClausesFilter

  • java.lang.Object
    • alice.tuprolog.ClausesFilter

  •  class ClausesFilter
extends java.lang.Object
    ClausesFilter has the aim to reduce the number of clauses that must be verified for goal unification.

    "Since Prolog programmers have a natural tendency to write code in a data structure-directed manner using discriminating patterns as first argument, it is quite accceptable to limit indexing to key on the first argument only" (Warren's Abstract Machine - A tutorial reconstruction, Hassan Kaci)

    According to the citation above, the actual implementation checks goal's first argument type and uses it to choose clauses.

    Since:
    2.2
    Author:
    Paolo Contessi

    • Method Detail

      • filterClauses

        public static OneWayList<ClauseInfo> filterClauses(java.util.List<ClauseInfo> familyClauses,
                                   Term goal)
        Iterates familyClauses and select those claues which, in all probability, could match with given goal.
        Parameters:
        familyClauses - The list of clauses whose head predicate as same name and same arity
        goal - The goal to be resolved
        Returns:
        The list of clauses (subset of familyClauses) which more probably match with goal
